text:
ge II Uterine Sarcoma
		                    Treatment of stage II uterine sarcoma may include the following:         -  Surgery (total abdominal hysterectomy, bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy, and lymphadenectomy).     - Surgery followed by radiation therapy to the pelvis.    - Surgery followed by chemotherapy.        Check the list of NCI-supported cancer clinical trials that are now accepting patients with stage II uterine sarcoma. For more specific results, refine the search by using other sea
